page.title: 10Farming around Keswick.
page.content: The farm we went to owns 70 acres of land and rents 60 in the summer.This particular farm is not a crop farm only grazing and silage. On the farm there are 100 Scotch Blackface ewes,30 Herefordshire cross lambs and 100 other lambs that are sold for meat.there are 50 Fresian Dairy cows and they hire a bull in August.Every year each cow produces 5200 litres of milk. In the slurry pit there is a pipe which pours slurry into the muck spreader.This sprays slurry around the fields to fertilise them. Last year a cow fell into the slurry pit but the farmer managed to get her out.Also last year a three day old calf,which was in the middle of a field,was struck by lightening and died immediately.
